The White Queen is a British television drama series based on Philippa Gregory's bestselling historical novel series The Cousins' War. The first episode was broadcast on BBC One on 16 June 2013. It will be broadcast in the United States on Starz on 10 August 2013.

Set against the backdrop of the Wars of the Roses, the series is the story of the women caught up in the long-drawn-out conflict for the throne of England. It starts in 1464ÃŽâ€œÃƒâ€¡ÃƒÂ¶the nation has been at war for nine years fighting over who is the rightful King of England, as two sides of the same family, the House of York and the House of Lancaster, are in violent conflict over the throne. The story focuses on three women in their quest for power, as they manipulate behind the scenes of historyÃŽâ€œÃƒâ€¡ÃƒÂ¶Elizabeth Woodville, Margaret Beaufort and Anne Neville

Having been widowed and lost all she has in the War of the Roses, Elizabeth Grey heads to see the passing King Edward of York to appeal to have the lands that previously belonged to her husband returned to her. The kind and handsome Edward is instantly drawn to Elizabeth's beauty, and its not long before the king reveals his desires for her. Determined not be his mistress, Elizabeth sees no future for them; until he reveals his shocking plans to marry her and make her Queen of England. However, this is a decision that will not settle well with England's court, especially Edward's most trusted adviser Lord Warwick.
